meanings.definition: The quality or condition of lacking qualities traditionally associated with men.
meanings.sent1: His unmanliness was evident in his fear of spiders.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's unmanliness was frowned upon by his peers.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unmanliness, he excelled in the art of baking.
meanings.sent4: The unmanliness of the situation made him feel vulnerable and exposed.
meanings.sent5: The unmanliness of his actions contrasted sharply with his rugged appearance.

meanings.definition: Behavior or characteristics considered not typical of a man.
meanings.sent1: Her unmanliness was evident in her love for floral patterns.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's unmanliness added a unique charm to his performances.
meanings.sent3: His unmanliness shone through when he screamed at the sight of a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The unmanliness of his fashion choices raised eyebrows at the party.
meanings.sent5: The unmanliness of his voice surprised everyone who heard him speak.
